revised_title: Inelastic Scattering of Slow Electrons in Gases: Experimental Techniques and Results
tldr: The authors developed an improved experimental setup to study the inelastic scattering of slow electrons in gases. They extended their measurements to lower electron energies and larger scattering angles, providing a more comprehensive understanding of the phenomenon. Their findings support the idea that the results for inelastic scattering are due to single scattering in the gas, with no significant contribution from multiple scattering.
